entries.question: What is functional medicine?
entries.answer: Functional medicine is a systems biology-based approach that focuses on identifying and addressing the root cause of disease. It views the body as one integrated system, not a collection of independent organs divided by medical specialties.

entries.question: How is functional medicine different from conventional medicine?
entries.answer: While conventional medicine often treats symptoms, functional medicine seeks to understand WHY symptoms occur. It looks at the whole person - genetics, environment, lifestyle - rather than just the disease.

entries.question: What are the 5 pillars of functional medicine?
entries.answer: The 5 pillars are: 1) Sleep & Relaxation, 2) Exercise & Movement, 3) Nutrition, 4) Stress Management, and 5) Relationships & Community. These form the foundation of optimal health.

entries.question: What is gut health and why does it matter?
entries.answer: Gut health refers to the balance of microorganisms in the digestive tract. It affects immunity, mental health, skin, and chronic disease risk. About 70% of the immune system resides in the gut.

entries.question: What is inflammation?
entries.answer: Inflammation is the body's natural immune response. Acute inflammation helps heal injuries, but chronic inflammation is linked to heart disease, diabetes, cancer, and autoimmune conditions.

entries.question: What are common functional medicine lab tests?
entries.answer: Common tests include: comprehensive metabolic panel, thyroid panel (TSH, T3, T4), vitamin D, B12, iron studies, inflammatory markers (CRP, ESR), and sometimes specialty tests like organic acids or stool analysis.

entries.question: What is an elimination diet?
entries.answer: An elimination diet removes common trigger foods (gluten, dairy, soy, eggs, corn, sugar) for 3-4 weeks, then reintroduces them one at a time to identify which foods cause symptoms.

entries.question: How can I help a student who is struggling with the course?
entries.answer: Encourage them to: 1) Break lessons into smaller chunks, 2) Take notes while watching, 3) Apply concepts to their own health journey, 4) Join study groups or community discussions, 5) Reach out for 1-on-1 mentorship.

entries.question: What should I tell students about certification?
entries.answer: Upon completing all modules and passing the final assessment, students receive their Functional Medicine Health Coach certification from AccrediPro Academy, which is recognized by major health coaching organizations.
